comments:
Build ID: 3.3.1

Steps To Reproduce:
Using TPTP 4.4.1 all-in-one 3-Dec build, I consistently get an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException attempting to perform Thread Analysis on some Eclipse plugins.

Output to the console is:
bash:jamesb:lc-cbga-150:12712> Exception in thread "TCPDataFlusher" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

Shortly afterwards the debuggee Eclipse fails.  I can't seem to find any more informative log items than this.

More information:

I'm getting this too, and I'm currently trying to pin down the trigger - I have two almost-identical launch configs, one of which runs a standard set of build classes, the other prepends some local source onto the classpath.  I've been trying out the TPTP plugin and I've found that the "standard build" launch works a treat but the one that includes extra local source falls over soon after starting with the following on the eclipse console:

Exception in thread "TCPDataFlusher" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 8192
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ACTCPDataServer$ACBufferFlusher.processData(ACTCPDataServer.java:356)
        at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ACTCPDataServer$ACBufferFlusher.run(ACTCPDataServer.java:412)

Note that it doesn't fail straight away - part of the app's GUI appears before failing.

I'll post a follow-up when I work out what I need to remove from the second launch to get it to work.  Hopefully that'll provide a big hint.
